intro: Ostodes paniculata var. paniculata, commonly known as the panicled ostodes, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant produces small, dry fruits called samaras, which are dispersed by wind. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
